benchmark_details.name: Mind2Web 2
benchmark_details.overview: Mind2Web 2 is a benchmark of 130 realistic, high-quality, and long-horizon tasks that require real-time web browsing and extensive information synthesis, constructed with over 1,000 hours of human labor. It aims to evaluate agentic search systems on complex, time-varying tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To rigorously evaluate agentic search systems on realistic and long-horizon tasks involving real-time web search and browsing.

data.source: Constructed with over 1,000 hours of human labor across diverse practical domains.
data.annotation: Tasks were validated by experienced annotators.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed based on aggregation of correct evaluations from the rubric.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in completing complex, time-varying tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: The best-performing agent is OpenAI Deep Research, achieving 50-70% human performance in time-varying tasks.
methodology.validation: Tasks and evaluation methods underwent multi-stage validation involving expert annotators.
